public abstract class RepeatingReducer<K,V,A,R>
extends Reducer<K,V,A,R>

A reducer that repeats execution until done.

Author:
Spence Koehler

getActionKey

protected abstract A getActionKey(java.io.File file)
Given a file (or directory), determine its action key.

the file's (or directory's) action key or null if not applicable.

run

public void run()
Description copied from class: MapReduceBase
Run the DirWalker.

If the preRunHook is successful, initialization will be invoked and the walker will be run; after which, the flush action factory will be finalized and the postRunHook will be invoked.

If an IOException occurs during the processing, it will be rethrown as an IllegalStateException.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class MapReduceBase<K,V,A,R>

preReduceHook

protected boolean preReduceHook()
Perform any tasks before running reduce for the current chain number.

This is intended to be overridden by implementations that require additional setup or control over the repeated reduce loop.

Returns:
true to execute the next reduce phase or false to terminate.

postReduceHook

protected boolean postReduceHook()
Perform any tasks immediately after running a reduce phase (before reset).

This is intended to be overridden by implementations that require additional control over the repeated reduce loop.

Returns:
true to reset and run another reducer phase (if warranted) or false to terminate immediately.
